page.title: 07Verwood C.E.First School.
page.content: Today,Summer Term 1985,Verwood C.E. First School occupies the same red-brick building.The two original schoolrooms have become the large classroom which houses the infants.Another 6m by 5.5m room,added in 1899,is the classroom for junior children.The school roll stands at 69 girls and boys: 29 infants(rising 5 to 6) + 30 juniors (7 to 9). The school has a Headmistress and two full-time assistant teachers, a part-time anciliary helper and a secretary on two mornings a week. Reading,writing and mathematics form the core of the curriculum with topic work broadening its scope into History,Geography,Science and Nature Study.The children enjoy water play, construction toys of wood or plastic, climbing frames and blocks,many sports (swimming,football,tennis,hockey etc.)
